definitions.definition: the quality of having parts that match each other, especially in a way that is attractive, or similarity of shape or contents:
examples: The design of the house had a pleasing symmetry, its oblong shape being picked up in its elongated windows.

definitions.definition: in mathematics, the quality of having two parts that match exactly, either when one half is like an image of the other half in a mirror, or when one part can take the place of another if it is turned 90° or 180°
